Package chat

Class Server

  • java.lang.Object
    • chat.Server
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable
    public class Server
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    This class represents the Server side of our chat application. a Server object will run as a Thread hence this class will implement Runnable. The server is the "Brain" of our application. The server will initiate itself with the ServerGUI (or without it) The server will listen for any connection on the port given (valid ports 1024-65553), and as soon as a connection is made- The server will initiate a ConnectionThread Thread which will handle all communication between the user connected and the server. Then the server will keep listening for new clients. (Until disconnection happens or the Stop Server button pressed). The server will have the following functions: broadcastServEvents, broadcastMsgs, sendPvtMsg, removeConnection, silentRemoveConnection, getUsersOnline, stopServer, run (Override run of Runnable). Since the server will always listen for new connections, these functions will actually be called from a ConnectionThread thread, hence some of these functions will be Synchronized. The Server will store the following: its Port, its ServerGUI (so it can update UI elements), ArrayList of ConnectionThread connections (to manage all currently online users) and a boolean keepGoing which indicates to terminate the thread or not.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void run()
      This method will be called as soon as this Thread is created. we override the run() method of Runnable so we can manage the server properly.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Server

        public Server​(int port)
        Constructor method for the Server. This constructor is used mainly with the CMD given only a port. (no GUI). This constructor is used to test SERVER logic and functions, including Server communication to Client through TELNET inside CMD. And used for the JUnit tests.
        Parameters:
        port - Integer, between 1024 to 65553.

      • Server

        public Server​(int port,
              ServerGUI anyGUI)
        Constructor method for the Server. Will get initiated from a GUI using a button. This constructor initiate the Server with a given port number
        Parameters:
        port - Integer, between 1024-65553 (check for validation doesn't happen in the constructor).
        anyGUI - ServerGUI, will get initiated from a ServerGUI button and will pass itself (the gui) to the constructor.
